root.text: create your own listener or patch so that you can update the `stream.on_heartbeat` <https://github.com/liampauling/betfair/blob/f370d111d2e7adf1ca4221fc8cc4b028e4b2b2f8/betfairlightweight/streaming/stream.py#L46|func>

func

text:
Hi <@U4H19D1D2>, just getting back to this.. I overrode the `stream.on_data` <https://github.com/liampauling/betfair/blob/f370d111d2e7adf1ca4221fc8cc4b028e4b2b2f8/betfairlightweight/streaming/listener.py#L111|func> so that I store
`data.get("statusCode")` and `self.status`. This is enough for me, as this 2 variables are updated with every heartbeat, right?

elements.text: Hi
, just getting back to this.. I overrode the
stream.on_data
func
so that I store
data.get("statusCode")
and
self.status
. This is enough for me, as this 2 variables are updated with every heartbeat, right?

newsletter

text: "As with previous years there can often be trainer/jockey multiples which inevitably gain traction as the runners are confirmed and the shorter priced runners roll up. We do get contact from the trading team to assist in offsetting the liability and will get in contact with Premium accounts to see if they would take some of that risk. If you would be in the position to offer this,please get in contact with your account manager to register your interest"

elements.text: "As with previous years there can often be trainer/jockey multiples which inevitably gain traction as the runners are confirmed and the shorter priced runners roll up. We do get contact from the trading team to assist in offsetting the liability and will get in contact with Premium accounts to see if they would take some of that risk. If you would be in the position to offer this,please get in contact with your account manager to register your interest"

text: I’ve been contacted in the past to ask if I’m interested in adding liquidity to a particular bet, but I’ve never taken it, so I suspect that’s why they haven’t asked me again recently.

text: I don’t take one-off oversized positions on particular bets even if they are +EV. But I suspect some of the bigger syndicates are happy to do so.

text: Darkpools are very good for allowing large sized executions without causing too much price impact (presuming the participants don't then hedge this flow back to back on a public venue but internalise it or hedge off to another participant off-exchange)
